# Hyperfocus - RSVP Speed Reader

A browser extension that helps you read faster using Rapid Serial Visual Presentation (RSVP) technique with optimal recognition point highlighting. Perfect for anyone who wants to speed up their reading.

**NOTE**: Code is almost fully generated by LLM.

## Features

- ğŸ“„ Upload PDF or TXT files
- âš¡ Adjustable reading speed (100-1000 WPM)
- ğŸ¯ Red focal point on optimal letter position
- ğŸ“– Side panel showing full text with current position
- ğŸ–±ï¸ Click any word in the text panel to jump to it
- ğŸŒ“ Dark/Light mode
- âŒ¨ï¸ Keyboard shortcuts (Space, Arrow keys, R)
- ğŸ–±ï¸ Right-click context menu: "Read with Hyperfocus"
- ğŸ’¾ Saves your speed and view preferences

## Installation

### Quick Start (5 minutes):

**Load in Chrome/Edge/Brave**:
   - Open browser and go to `chrome://extensions/`
   - Enable "Developer mode" (toggle in top-right)
   - Click "Load unpacked"
   - Select your `hyperfocus-extension` folder
   - Done! Click the extension icon in your toolbar

**Load in Firefox**:
   - Open Firefox and go to `about:debugging#/runtime/this-firefox`
   - Click "Load Temporary Add-on"
   - Select the `manifest.json` file
   - Done! (Note: temporary installation - removed when you close Firefox)

### For permanent Firefox installation:
- You'll need to sign it through Mozilla Add-ons
- Or use Firefox Developer Edition for unsigned extensions

## How to Use

### Method 1: Upload Files
1. Click the Hyperfocus icon in your toolbar
2. Upload a PDF or TXT file
3. Adjust speed with the slider (start at 300 WPM)
4. Press Play (or hit Spacebar)
5. Use the text panel on the right to see your progress
6. Click any word in the text panel to jump to it

### Method 2: Selected Text (Best Feature!)
1. Select any text on any webpage
2. Right-click and choose "Read with Hyperfocus"
3. The extension opens with your selected text ready to read
4. Perfect for reading articles, emails, or any web content

### Keyboard Shortcuts
- **Space**: Play/Pause
- **â†/â†’**: Navigate word by word
- **R**: Reset to beginning

### Tips for Best Results
- Start at 250-300 WPM and gradually increase
- The red focal letter helps prevent regression (re-reading)
- Take breaks every 20-30 minutes
- Use the side panel to track your progress
- Click words in the side panel to skip ahead or review

## Troubleshooting

**PDF upload doesn't work:**
- PDFs must have selectable text (not scanned images)
- Try with a text-based PDF first
- Check browser console for errors (F12 â†’ Console tab)

**Context menu not showing:**
- Reload the extension (toggle it off/on in chrome://extensions/)
- Try on a different webpage
- Make sure you have text selected

**Text view panel not showing:**
- Click the "Show â‰¡" button in the text view header
- Your preference is saved, so it might be hidden from last time

## Privacy

- No data collection
- No external network requests (except PDF.js CDN for PDF parsing)
- All processing happens locally in your browser
- Your preferences are saved locally using Chrome storage API
